function windowTitle()
{

        parent.document.title="HelloRoom";
    }
}

<H2>
<FONT SIZE="-1">
context.apps.demos.helloroom</FONT>
<BR>
Class HelloRoom</H2>
<PRE>
java.lang.Object
  <IMG SRC="../../../../resources/inherit.gif" ALT="extended by "><B>context.apps.demos.helloroom.HelloRoom</B>
</PRE>
<DL>
<DT><B>Direct Known Subclasses:</B> <DD><A HREF="../../../../context/apps/demos/helloroom/HelloRoomIntelligible.html" title="class in context.apps.demos.helloroom">HelloRoomIntelligible</A></DD>
</DL>
<HR>
<DL>
<DT><PRE>public class <B>HelloRoom</B><DT>extends java.lang.Object</DL>
</PRE><map id="APIVIZ" name="APIVIZ">
<area shape="rect" id="node1" href="HelloRoomIntelligible.html" title="&#171;static&#187; HelloRoomIntelligible" alt="" coords="5,89,147,135"/>
<area shape="rect" id="node2" href="HelloRoom.html" title="&#171;static&#187; HelloRoom" alt="" coords="33,5,119,51"/>
</map>

<CENTER><IMG SRC="HelloRoom.png" USEMAP="#APIVIZ" BORDER="0"></CENTER>



<P>
Main class for Hello World context-aware application of a living room smart lamp.
 It demonstrates four steps to create a simple context-aware application:
 <ol>
        <li>Modeling context with Widgets</li>
        <li>Modeling reasoning with Enactors</li>
        <li>Modeling behavior with Services</li>
        <li>Combining models</li>
 </ol>
 Running this program would launch a GUI simulation of a room sensor suite
 with brightness and presence sensors, and lamp light level.
<P>

<P>
<HR>

<P>
